title: St Mary's Coast Path - Isles of Scilly Walk Route

images.title: David Purchase / Innisidgen Carn, Upper Chamber
images.caption: Upper Innisidgen burial grave, also known as "The Giant's Grave" on Innisidgen Hill, St Mary's Island, Isles of Scilly, Overlooking Crow Sound and the Eastern Isles of Scilly.

images.title: David Lally / Entrance Arch to The Woolpack Battery
images.caption: Entrance Arch to The Woolpack Battery. The Island on the Horizon is Gugh.

images.title: Chris Downer / St. Mary’s: inner pier
images.caption: St. Mary's, inner pier. From the inner harbour, looking towards the lifeboat station and church across the bay.

images.title: Chris Downer / St. Mary’s: view over the Scillys
images.caption: St. Marys: view over the Scillys Rocks above the lifeboat station provide a good vantage point to view the channel between the majority of the islands.

description: Follow the beautiful coast path around St Mary's - the largest of the Isles of Scilly. You will pass lovely beaches, picturesque harbours and rocky clifftops as you make your way around the island's perimeter. There's also some history with a visit to the Woolpack Battery and Garrison Walls. To continue your walking around the Scilly Isles head to the beautiful Tresco Abbey Gardens .
